sentences: Ta võttis kogu süü enda peale.
Meie süüd ei ole võimalik vabastada.
context: The Estonian word 'süü' is a noun that means fault, error, guilt, or blame. It can refer to moral responsibility for wrongdoing (guilt/blame) or simply an error or mistake (fault/error). The word follows Estonian grammar patterns and appears in various cases depending on its grammatical function in a sentence.
